column4: I tried, but I saw the time was wrong, so I tried to change it, then it froze...
phlite_kontrol> battery settings
hmmm
ok
now CTRL ALT DEL isn't working...
I'm running it off the CD
trying to install it
along side my windows
I'm using a differewnt computer
it does not work
are you running a LiveCD, or are you using VMWar?
then of course CTRL ALT DEL wont work
there always are
that's why tells are so helpful
if you right-click on a username you can open a dialog window with them as a private or instant message
well still, just use people's names in your messages
much easier to see
how much RAM do you have?
okay, then, what is the problem you are encountering again?
there should be an icon on the desktop I think for the installation
but again, I personally wouldn't recommend using LiveCD for installation, but that's just me
so, are you encountering a problem?
okay...?
yes, it's called dual-booting
please keep typing my name, you just need to type is and then hit tab
okay
ok
now, Resize IDE1 master, partition#1 (hda1) and use free space
use largest continual free space
does it not inform you what your partition currently looks like?
I don't even know what that IS
does it not tell you how many partitions you have the size of each?
no, I don't know what you are talking about
okay, go to manually edit partition table
that should inform you of your partition table
now what, I'm there
what does it say?
which part?
it should make mention of hda1, etc
how many hda's are ther?
now what
it says the symbol ? under size, or is that just ther?
no symbol, just   nn.nn GiB
n being a number
oh, okay, how big is hda1 and hda2?
I take it you want Ubuntu to run in the second partition, then?
hda1 should be windows, and should be partitioned as FAT32, while hda2 is unallocated or freespace, yes?
I guess so....  along side windows?  same files?
what is hda1?
hda1 is ntfs
ah, right, I'm sorry:  NTFS is Windows
but you are not using the second partition, right?
ah
I wonder what's in there...
I can't really tell you what the second partition is I'm afraid
fat32
I know what filesystem type it is, but do you know what's on it?
can I make a new ine
as in, might it be a swap partition or might there have been another Linux OS installed prior...
I really can't say, I don't know how to mount filesystems in Windows, only in Linux
never installed linux before
I know, but since you only have windows installed, you can only use windows to check the partition
do you have any unallocated memory (ie, is freespace)
it should tell you on the partition table
just because you have freespace on your windows partition does not mean you have freespace outside of that partition
you will have to resize the windows partition in order to get that space
tell me how
did you run Defrag on your windows partition before trying to do this?
I'd recommend that you do it again
you see, when you resize a partition, it has a chance to delete files from it
defragging helps keep that chance low
I defrag and resize?
yes
yes
